intro: Crepis kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It is characterized by its hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its mountainous habitat. Crepis kilimandscharica plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and contributing to soil stabilization.
